intro: Boisduvalia densiflora var. bipartita, commonly known as the two-parted bovisduvalia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its dense, flaky foliage and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salt spray and drought conditions. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
